t: Mark 14
After*p two days was the feast of the passover, and of unleavened bread: and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft, and put him to death.
But*p they said, Not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar of the people.

And*p being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at meat, there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of spikenard very precious; and she brake the box, and poured it on his head.
And*p there were some that had indignation within themselves, and said, Why was this waste of the ointment made?
For*p it might have been sold for more than three hundred pence, and have been given to the poor. And they murmured against her.
And*p Jesus said, Let*r her*r alone;*r why*r trouble*r ye*r her?*r she*r hath*r wrought*r a*r good*r work*r on*r me.*r
For*rp ye*r have*r the*r poor*r with*r you*r always,*r and*r whensoever*r ye*r will*r ye*r may*r do*r them*r good:*r but*r me*r ye*r have*r not*r always.*r
She*rp hath*r done*r what*r she*r could:*r she*r is*r come*r aforehand*r to*r anoint*r my*r body*r to*r the*r burying.*r

Verily*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Wheresoever*r this*r gospel*r shall*r be*r preached*r throughout*r the*r whole*r world,*r this*r also*r that*r she*r hath*r done*r shall*r be*r spoken*r of*r for*r a*r memorial*r of*r her.*r
And*p Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went unto the chief priests, to betray him unto them.
And*p when they heard it, they were glad, and promised to give him money. And he sought how he might conveniently betray him.
And*p the first day of unleavened bread, when they killed the passover, his disciples said unto him, Where wilt thou that we go and prepare that thou mayest eat the passover?
And*p he sendeth forth two of his disciples, and saith unto them, Go*r ye*r into*r the*r city,*r and*r there*r shall*r meet*r you*r a*r man*r bearing*r a*r pitcher*r of*r water:*r follow*r him.*r

And*rp wheresoever*r he*r shall*r go*r in,*r say*r ye*r to*r the*r goodman*r of*r the*r house,*r The*r Master*r saith,*r Where*r is*r the*r guestchamber,*r where*r I*r shall*r eat*r the*r passover*r with*r my*r disciples?*r
And*rp he*r will*r shew*r you*r a*r large*r upper*r room*r furnished*r and*r prepared:*r there*r make*r ready*r for*r us.*r
And*p his disciples went forth, and came into the city, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.
And*p in the evening he cometh with the twelve.
And*p as they sat and did eat, Jesus said, Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r One*r of*r you*r which*r eateth*r with*r me*r shall*r betray*r me.*r
And*p they began to be sorrowful, and to say unto him one by one, Is it I? and another said, Is it I?
And*p he answered and said unto them, It*r is*r one*r of*r the*r twelve,*r that*r dippeth*r with*r me*r in*r the*r dish.*r

The*rp Son*r of*r man*r indeed*r goeth,*r as*r it*r is*r written*r of*r him:*r but*r woe*r to*r that*r man*r by*r whom*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r is*r betrayed!*r good*r were*r it*r for*r that*r man*r if*r he*r had*r never*r been*r born.*r
And*p as they did eat, Jesus took bread, and blessed, and brake it, and gave to them, and said, Take,*r eat:*r this*r is*r my*r body.*r
And*p he took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them: and they all drank of it.
And*p he said unto them, This*r is*r my*r blood*r of*r the*r new*r testament,*r which*r is*r shed*r for*r many.*r
Verily*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r I*r will*r drink*r no*r more*r of*r the*r fruit*r of*r the*r vine,*r until*r that*r day*r that*r I*r drink*r it*r new*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
And*p when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.

And*p Jesus saith unto them, All*r ye*r shall*r be*r offended*r because*r of*r me*r this*r night:*r for*r it*r is*r written,*r I*r will*r smite*r the*r shepherd,*r and*r the*r sheep*r shall*r be*r scattered.*r
But*rp after*r that*r I*r am*r risen,*r I*r will*r go*r before*r you*r into*r Galilee.*r
But*p Peter said unto him, Although all shall be offended, yet will not I.
And*p Jesus saith unto him, Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r thee,*r That*r this*r day,*r even*r in*r this*r night,*r before*r the*r cock*r crow*r twice,*r thou*r shalt*r deny*r me*r thrice.*r
But*p he spake the more vehemently, If I should die with thee, I will not deny thee in any wise. Likewise also said they all.
And*p they came to a place which was named Gethsemane: and he saith to his disciples, Sit*r ye*r here,*r while*r I*r shall*r pray.*r
And*p he taketh with him Peter and James and John, and began to be sore amazed, and to be very heavy;
And*p saith unto them, My*r soul*r is*r exceeding*r sorrowful*r unto*r death:*r tarry*r ye*r here,*r and*r watch.*r
And*p he went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass from him.
And*p he said, Abba,*r Father,*r all*r things*r are*r possible*r unto*r thee;*r take*r away*r this*r cup*r from*r me:*r nevertheless*r not*r what*r I*r will,*r but*r what*r thou*r wilt.*r
And*p he cometh, and findeth them sleeping, and saith unto Peter, Simon,*r sleepest*r thou?*r couldest*r not*r thou*r watch*r one*r hour?*r
Watch*rp ye*r and*r pray,*r lest*r ye*r enter*r into*r temptation.*r The*r spirit*r truly*r is*r ready,*r but*r the*r flesh*r is*r weak.*r
And*p again he went away, and prayed, and spake the same words.
And*p when he returned, he found them asleep again, (for their eyes were heavy,) neither wist they what to answer him.

And*p he cometh the third time, and saith unto them, Sleep*r on*r now,*r and*r take*r your*r rest:*r it*r is*r enough,*r the*r hour*r is*r come;*r behold,*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r is*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r sinners.*r
Rise*rp up,*r let*r us*r go;*r lo,*r he*r that*r betrayeth*r me*r is*r at*r hand.*r
And*p immediately, while he yet spake, cometh Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
And*p he that betrayed him had given them a token, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is he; take him, and lead him away safely.
And*p as soon as he was come, he goeth straightway to him, and saith, Master, master; and kissed him.
And*p they laid their hands on him, and took him.
And*p one of them that stood by drew a sword, and smote a servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
And*p Jesus answered and said unto them, Are*r ye*r come*r out,*r as*r against*r a*r thief,*r with*r swords*r and*r with*r staves*r to*r take*r me?*r
I*rp was*r daily*r with*r you*r in*r the*r temple*r teaching,*r and*r ye*r took*r me*r not:*r but*r the*r scriptures*r must*r be*r fulfilled.*r
And*p they all forsook him, and fled.
And*p there followed him a certain young man, having a linen cloth cast about his naked body; and the young men laid hold on him:
And*p he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.
And*p they led Jesus away to the high priest: and with him were assembled all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes.
And*p Peter followed him afar off, even into the palace of the high priest: and he sat with the servants, and warmed himself at the fire.
And*p the chief priests and all the council sought for witness against Jesus to put him to death; and found none.
For*p many bare false witness against him, but their witness agreed not together.
And*p there arose certain, and bare false witness against him, saying,
We*p heard him say, I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and within three days I will build another made without hands.
But*p neither so did their witness agree together.
And*p the high priest stood up in the midst, and asked Jesus, saying, Answerest thou nothing? what is it which these witness against thee?
But*p he held his peace, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, and said unto him, Art thou the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?
And*p Jesus said, I*r am:*r and*r ye*r shall*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r sitting*r on*r the*r right*r hand*r of*r power,*r and*r coming*r in*r the*r clouds*r of*r heaven.*r
Then*p the high priest rent his clothes, and saith, What need we any further witnesses?
Ye*p have heard the blasphemy: what think ye? And they all condemned him to be guilty of death.
And*p some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to buffet him, and to say unto him, Prophesy: and the servants did strike him with the palms of their hands.
And*p as Peter was beneath in the palace, there cometh one of the maids of the high priest:
And*p when she saw Peter warming himself, she looked upon him, and said, And thou also wast with Jesus of Nazareth.
But*p he denied, saying, I know not, neither understand I what thou sayest. And he went out into the porch; and the cock crew.
And*p a maid saw him again, and began to say to them that stood by, This is one of them.
And*p he denied it again. And a little after, they that stood by said again to Peter, Surely thou art one of them: for thou art a Galilaean, and thy speech agreeth thereto.
But*p he began to curse and to swear, saying, I know not this man of whom ye speak.

And*p the second time the cock crew. And Peter called to mind the word that Jesus said unto him, Before*r the*r cock*r crow*r twice,*r thou*r shalt*r deny*r me*r thrice.*r And when he thought thereon, he wept.
